item.title: Recover Ubuntu from initramfs error caused by improper shutdown
item.description: Recover Ubuntu from initramfs error caused by improper shutdown Issue description Following a force shutdown of the server, the system failed to boot with following message: initramfs: waiting for /dev/mapper/ubuntu–vg-ubuntu–lv to appear … timeout waiting … … Then the init process crashed with kernel panic. Solution As if it’s due to initramfs damage by the improper shutdown, so the solution is to re-generate the initramfs. Boot from a live CD/USB Could either burn a live iso to a USB stick or mount the ISO to the server (how to mount the ISO to a server via its BMC/IPMI tools, is out of the scope).
